definition: sea land air (transport, or military operations)
ocean/sea/CL:個|个[ge4],片[pian4]/great number of people or things/(dialect) numerous

sentences.english: It has come into the solid traffic layout across sea, land and air.
sentences.chinese: 轄區已形成海陸空立體交叉的交通格局。

sentences.english: The army, navy and airforce are all controlled by the Ministry of Defence.
sentences.chinese: 海陸空三軍均由國防部管轄。

sentences.english: Guangzhou is South China sea and air transportation center.
sentences.chinese: 廣州是華南地區的海陸空交通中心。

sentences.english: S. military is searching for the two by air, ground and in the water.
sentences.chinese: 美國軍方調用了海陸空三軍在搜尋那兩名失蹤士兵。

sentences.english: Mr Ouattara says he's ordered the closure of land, air and sea borders.
sentences.chinese: 瓦塔拉表示他已下令關閉海陸空邊境。

sentences.english: Shanhaiguan three-dimensional traffic conditions are very favorable sea and air.
sentences.chinese: 山海關海陸空立體交通條件十分優越。

sentences.english: This includes all vehicles land and sea.
sentences.chinese: 這包括海陸空的所有交通工具。

definition: through transport/through traffic jointly organized by different enterprises
interregional/spanning two or more PRC provinces
to make an amphibious assault/to seize a beachhead/to gain a foothold in (a new market)
Man Kam To (place in Hong Kong)
Tun District – area of Taichung (in Taiwan) between the coastal (western) part of the city and the mountains to the east
sea and land/ocean and continent/army and navy
Four Asian Tigers/East Asian Tigers/Four Little Dragons (East Asian economic powers: Taiwan, South Korea, Singapore and Hong Kong)
roads open in all directions (idiom); accessible from all sides
